intro: Obolaria virginica, commonly known as the Virginia obolaria, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Obolaria virginica is often found in association with other shade-tolerant species in its native habitat.
